title: Sample Quiz - Multiple Question Types
description: This is a comprehensive example quiz demonstrating all supported question types. You can use this as a template for creating your own quizzes.

questions.questionText: What is the capital of France?
questions.hint: It's a city known for the Eiffel Tower.
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and largest city of France.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are programming languages? (Select all that apply)
questions.hint: HTML and CSS are markup and styling languages, not programming languages.
questions.explanation: Java, Python, and JavaScript are all programming languages. HTML and CSS are markup and styling languages respectively.

questions.questionText: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun.
questions.hint: Think about the order of planets in our solar system.
questions.explanation: Yes, Earth is the third planet from the Sun, after Mercury and Venus.

questions.questionText: Explain what photosynthesis is in one sentence.

content.answer: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy to produce glucose and oxygen.

questions.hint: Think about what plants do with sunlight.
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis is a process used by plants and other organisms to convert light energy into chemical energy that can later be released to fuel the organism's activities.

questions.questionText: Java is a {1} language and Python is a {2} language.

content.text: Java is a {1} language and Python is a {2} language.

questions.hint: Think about how these languages are executed.
questions.explanation: Java is a compiled language (compiled to bytecode), while Python is an interpreted language.

questions.questionText: Arrange these historical events in chronological order:
questions.hint: World War I happened first, followed by World War II.
questions.explanation: The correct chronological order is: World War I (1914-1918), World War II (1939-1945), Cold War (1947-1991), Fall of Berlin Wall (1989).

questions.questionText: Match the countries with their capitals:
questions.hint: Paris is the capital of France, Rome is the capital of Italy, and Madrid is the capital of Spain.
questions.explanation: France → Paris, Italy → Rome, Spain → Madrid

questions.questionText: Which statements comply with GDPR requirements?

statements.text: Personal data must be processed lawfully and transparently
Data can be stored indefinitely without user consent
Users have the right to access their personal data
Data can be sold to third parties without notification

questions.hint: GDPR emphasizes user rights and data protection.
questions.explanation: GDPR requires lawful processing, transparency, user access rights, and prohibits indefinite storage or unauthorized data sharing.
